The main consequence of the initial step of redevelopment was to demonstrate the possibility of creating an attractive and functional central city on this site, a demonstration that was followed by many subsequent construction activities that have changed the whole face of the city and the attitudes of its inhabitants.

11. 本节很大程度上归功于詹姆斯·G·马奇，他对这些问题进行了深入思考。请参阅他的《有限理性、模糊性和选择工程》，《贝尔经济学杂志》 9(1978)：587-608。

11. This section owes much to James G. March, who has thought deeply on these lines. See his "Bounded Rationality, Ambiguity, and the Engineering of Choice," Bell Journal of Economics 9(1978):587-608.

询问后期开发阶段是否与最初阶段一致（最初的设计是否得以实现）也是无关紧要的。实施的每一步都会创造新的情况；而新的情况为新的设计活动提供了起点。

It is also beside the point to ask whether the later stages of the development were consistent with the initial one—whether the original designs were realized. Each step of implementation created a new situation; and the new situation provided a starting point for fresh design activity.

制作复杂的设计，在很长一段时间内实施，并在实施过程中不断修改，这与油画有很多相似之处。在油画中，画布上的每一点新颜料都会形成某种图案，为画家提供源源不断的新想法。绘画过程是画家与画布之间循环互动的过程，其中当前的目标导致新的颜料应用，而逐渐变化的图案则暗示着新的目标。

Making complex designs that are implemented over a long period of time and continually modified in the course of implementation has much in common with painting in oil. In oil painting every new spot of pigment laid on the canvas creates some kind of pattern that provides a continuing source of new ideas to the painter. The painting process is a process of cyclical interaction between painter and canvas in which current goals lead to new applications of paint, while the gradually changing pattern suggests new goals.

起点

The Starting Point

最终目标的概念与我们预测或决定未来的有限能力不一致。我们行动的真正结​​果是为下一步行动建立初始条件。我们所谓的“最终”目标实际上是选择我们将留给继任者的初始条件的标准。

The idea of final goals is inconsistent with our limited ability to foretell or determine the future. The real result of our actions is to establish initial conditions for the next succeeding stage of action. What we call "final" goals are in fact criteria for choosing the initial conditions that we will leave to our successors.

我们希望为下一代留下怎样的世界？对他们来说，良好的初始条件是什么？一个理想的世界是为未来的决策者提供尽可能多的替代方案，避免做出他们无法撤销的不可逆转的承诺。正是核能部署决策中弥漫着不可逆转的气氛，使得这些决策如此困难。

How do we want to leave the world for the next generation? What are good initial conditions for them? One desideratum would be a world offering as many alternatives as possible to future decision makers, avoiding irreversible commitments that they cannot undo. It is the aura of irreversibility hanging about so many of the decisions of nuclear energy deployment that makes these decisions so difficult.

第二个愿望是让下一代决策者拥有更丰富的知识和更丰富的经验。 这里的目的是让他们不仅能够更好地评估替代方案，而且能够以更多、更丰富的方式体验世界。

A second desideratum is to leave the next generation of decision makers with a better body of knowledge and a greater capacity for experience. The aim here is to enable them not just to evaluate alternatives better but especially to experience the world in more and richer ways.

贝克尔和斯蒂格勒认为，我所提出的这类考虑可以在不放弃固定目标的前提下得到满足。12他们说，所需要的只是以足够抽象的形式定义从行动中获得的效用。在他们的方案中，一小时听音乐所产生的效用随着一个人享受音乐的能力而增加，这种能力是一种资本，可以通过事先投资于听音乐来增加。虽然我觉得他们提出这个问题的方式有点无趣，但也许它让没有目标的理性行为的想法不那么神秘。如果我们认为人类具有某种可改变的享受和欣赏生活的能力，那么投资于这种未来享受的能力肯定是社会决策的合理目标。

Becker and Stigler have argued that considerations of the sort I have been advancing can be accommodated without giving up the idea of fixed goals.12 All that is required, they say, is that the utilities to be obtained from actions be defined in sufficiently abstract form. In their scheme the utility yielded by an hour's listening to music increases with one's capacity for musical enjoyment, and this capacity is a kind of capital that can be increased by a prior investment in musical listening. While I find their way of putting the matter a trifle humorless, perhaps it makes the idea of rational behavior without goals less mysterious. If we conceive human beings as having some kind of alterable capacity for enjoyment and appreciation of life, then surely it is a reasonable goal for social decision to invest in that capacity for future enjoyment.

设计是有价值的活动

Designing as Valued Activity

与新目标可能从设计创作中产生这一观念密切相关的是，规划的目标之一可能是设计活动本身。设想各种可能性并加以阐述的行为本身就是一种令人愉快和宝贵的体验。正如实现的计划可能是新体验的源泉一样，设计过程的每一步都会开辟新的前景。设计是一种精神上的橱窗购物。不必购买任何东西即可从中获得乐趣。

Closely related to the notion that new goals may emerge from creating designs is the idea that one goal of planning may be the design activity itself. The act of envisioning possibilities and elaborating them is itself a pleasurable and valuable experience. Just as realized plans may be a source of new experiences, so new prospects are opened up at each step in the process of design. Designing is a kind of mental window shopping. Purchases do not have to be made to get pleasure from it.

人们有时会对现代科学技术提出这样的指责：如果我们知道如何做某件事，我们就无法抗拒去做。虽然人们可以想到反例，但这种说法有一定道理。然而，我们可以设想这样一个未来：我们对科学和设计的主要兴趣在于它们教给我们关于世界的知识，而不是它们允许我们对世界做什么。设计就像科学一样，既是理解的工具，也是行动的工具。

One of the charges sometimes laid against modern science and technology is that if we know how to do something, we cannot resist doing it. While one can think of counterexamples, the claim has some measure of truth. One can envisage a future, however, in which our main interest in both science and design will lie in what they teach us about the world and not in what they allow us to do to the world. Design like science is a tool for understanding as well as for acting.

12. GJ Stigler 和 GS Becker，“De Gustibus non est Disputandum”，《美国经济评论》，67（1977）：76-90。

12. G. J. Stigler and G. S. Becker, "De Gustibus non est Disputandum," American Economic Review, 67(1977):76-90.

社会规划与发展

Social Planning and Evolution

没有固定目标的社会规划与生物进化过程有很多共同之处。社会规划与进化一样，都是短视的。它着眼于眼前，试图创造一个比现在更好一点（读作“更适应”）的未来。这样做，它创造了一种新的局面，然后重复这个过程。在进化论中，没有任何定理可以从这种短视的爬山行为中提取出长期的发展方向。事实上，进化生物学家对假设这样的方向或引入任何“进步”概念极为谨慎。根据定义，适应者是那些生存和繁衍的人。

Social planning without fixed goals has much in common with the processes of biological evolution. Social planning, no less than evolution, is myopic. Looking a short distance ahead, it tries to generate a future that is a little better (read "fitter") than the present. In so doing, it creates a new situation in which the process is then repeated. In the theory of evolution there are no theorems that extract a long-run direction of development from this myopic hill climbing. In fact evolutionary biologists are extremely wary of postulating such a direction or of introducing any notion of "progress." By definition the fit are those who survive and multiply.

进化是否有一个长期方向，以及这个方向是否应被视为进步，当然是两个不同的问题。前者的答案可能是肯定的，而后者的答案可能是否定的。让我大胆推测一下社会和生物进化的方向，我将在接下来的两章中进一步阐述。我的推测绝对不是关于进步的主张。

Whether there is a long-run direction in evolution, and whether that direction is to be considered progress are of course two different questions. We might answer the former affirmatively but the latter negatively. Let me venture a speculation about the direction of social and biological evolution, which I will develop further in the next two chapters. My speculation is emphatically not a claim about progress.

从进化史（无论是生物进化史还是社会进化史）来看，人们可能推测，长期以来，多样性和复杂性一直存在。原子有一百多种，无机分子有数千种，有机分子有数十万种，生物体有数百万种。人类已经发明了数千种不同的语言，现代工业社会有数万种专门的职业。

From a reading of evolutionary history—whether biological or social—one might conjecture that there has been a long-run trend toward variety and complexity. There are more than a hundred kinds of atoms, thousands of kinds of inorganic molecules, hundreds of thousands of organic molecules, and millions of species of living organisms. Mankind has elaborated several thousand distinct languages, and modern industrial societies count their specialized occupations in the tens of thousands.

我将在接下来的章节中强调，形式可以以这种方式激增，因为更复杂的形式是从更简单的形式组合而成的。可供构建的构件集合越大越丰富，可以生成的结构就越复杂。

I shall emphasize in the following chapters that forms can proliferate in this way because the more complex arise out of a combinatoric play upon the simpler. The larger and richer the collection of building blocks that is available for construction, the more elaborate are the structures that can be generated.

如果存在这种趋向多样化的趋势，那么进化就不能被理解为一系列争夺固定环境利基的比赛，每场比赛都由最适合该环境的生物获胜。相反，进化带来了环境的扩散。大多数生物有机体适应的环境主要由其他生物组成，人类适应的环境 适应，主要是适应其他人类。每一种新的鸟类或哺乳动物都为一种或多种新种类的跳蚤提供了生存空间。

If there is such a trend toward variety, then evolution is not to be understood as a series of tournaments for the occupation of a fixed set of environmental niches, each tournament won by the organism that is fittest for that niche. Instead evolution brings about a proliferation of niches. The environments to which most biological organisms adapt are formed mainly of other organisms, and the environments to which human beings adapt, mainly of other human beings. Each new bird or mammal provides a niche for one or more new kind of flea.

万尼瓦尔·布什曾将科学描述为“无边无际的前沿”。科学可以是无边无际的，设计过程和人类社会的进化也可以是无边无际的，因为世界上的多样性是没有极限的。通过对一些原始元素进行组合，可以创造出无限的多样性。

Vannevar Bush wrote of science as an "endless frontier." It can be endless, as can be the process of design and the evolution of human society, because there is no limit on diversity in the world. By combinatorics on a few primitive elements, unbounded variety can be created.

社会设计课程

The Curriculum for Social Design

我们在此对社会规划过程的考察表明，上一章提出的设计课程有所延伸。主题 7，即设计问题的表示，必须加以扩展，以纳入构建组织作为问题表示框架、围绕限制因素构建表示以及表示非数值问题的技能。我们的讨论还表明，课程至少应包括六个新主题：

Our examination of the social planning process here suggests some extension of the curriculum for design that was proposed in the last chapter. Topic 7, the representation of design problems, must be expanded to incorporate the skills of constructing organizations as frameworks for problem representation, building representations around limiting factors, and representing non-numerical problems. Our discussion also suggests at least six new topics for the curriculum:

1.有限理性。在环境的复杂性远远大于自适应系统的计算能力的情况下理性的含义。

1. Bounded rationality. The meaning of rationality in situations where the complexity of the environment is immensely greater than the computational powers of the adaptive system.

2.规划数据。预测方法，预测和反馈在控制中的应用。

2. Data for planning. Methods of forecasting, the use of prediction and feedback in control.

3.识别客户。专业客户关系、社会作为客户、客户作为游戏中的玩家。

3. Identifying the client. Professional-client relations, society as the client, the client as player in a game.

4.社会设计中的组织。社会设计不仅主要由在组织中工作的人员进行，而且设计的一个重要目标是塑造和改变一般的社会组织，特别是个别的组织。

4. Organizations in social design. Not only is social design carried out mainly by people working in organizations, but an important goal of the design is to fashion and change social organization in general and individual organizations in particular.

5.时间和空间范围。时间的折现、确定进度、管理注意力。

5. Time and space horizons. The discounting of time, defining progress, managing attention.

6.设计时没有最终目标。为未来的灵活性而设计，以设计活动为目标，设计一个不断发展的系统。

6. Designing without final goals. Designing for future flexibility, design activity as goal, designing an evolving system.

除了对主题 2 和 3 至关重要的控制理论和博弈论之外，与这些附加主题相关的设计工具通常不如我们在上一章中描述的那么正式。但无论我们是否拥有所需的正式工具，这些主题对于社会设计过程都至关重要，以至于不能将它们从课程中忽略或省略。

With the exception of control theory and game theory, which are of central importance to topics 2 and 3, the design tools relevant to these additional topics are in general less formal than those we described in the previous chapter. But whether we have the formal tools we need or not, the topics are too crucial to the social design process to permit them to be ignored or omitted from the curriculum.

我们这个时代，人们并不介意表达自己的悲观和焦虑。人类确实面临着许多问题。我们一直都面临着这些问题，但也许并不总是像今天这样敏锐地意识到这些问题。如果我们认识到我们不必解决所有问题，我们可能会更加乐观这些问题。我们的基本任务——当然是足够大的任务——只是保持未来的选择开放，或者甚至通过创造新的多样性和新的利基来拓宽这些选择。我们的孙子孙女不能要求我们更多，我们只能为他们提供与我们一样的冒险机会，让他们追求新颖有趣的设计。

Our age is one in which people are not reluctant to express their pessimism and anxieties. It is true that humanity is faced with many problems. It always has been but perhaps not always with such keen awareness of them as we have today. We might be more optimistic if we recognized that we do not have to solve all of these problems. Our essential task—a big enough one to be sure—is simply to keep open the options for the future or perhaps even to broaden them a bit by creating new variety and new niches. Our grandchildren cannot ask more of us than that we offer to them the same chance for adventure, for the pursuit of new and interesting designs, that we have had.

7

7

复杂性的另类观点

Alternative Views of Complexity

本书前面的章节讨论了几种人工系统。我们研究的例子——特别是经济系统、商业公司、人类思维、复杂的工程设计和社会计划——从中等复杂到极度复杂（不一定按照我刚才列出的顺序）。最后两章更广泛地讨论了复杂性这一主题，以了解它对这些系统以及当今世界上其他突出的大型系统的结构和运作有何启示。

The preceding chapters of this book have discussed several kinds of artificial systems. The examples we have examined—in particular, economic systems, the business firm, the human mind, sophisticated engineering designs, and social plans—range from the moderately to the exceedingly complex (not necessarily in the order in which I have just listed them). These final two chapters address the topic of complexity more generally, to see what light it casts on the structure and operation of these and other large systems that are prominent in our world today.

复杂性的概念

Conceptions of Complexity

本世纪，人们对复杂性和复杂系统的兴趣不断涌现。第一次世界大战后的一次早期爆发催生了“整体论”一词，并引发了人们对“格式塔”和“创造性进化”的兴趣。第二次大规模爆发是在第二次世界大战后，最受欢迎的术语是“信息”、“反馈”、“控制论”和“一般系统”。在当前的爆发中，复杂性通常与“混沌”、“自适应系统”、“遗传算法”和“细胞自动机”有关。

This century has seen recurrent bursts of interest in complexity and complex systems. An early eruption, after World War I, gave birth to the term "holism," and to interest in "Gestalts" and "creative evolution." In a second major eruption, after World War II, the favorite terms were "information," "feedback," "cybernetics," and "general systems." In the current eruption, complexity is often associated with "chaos," "adaptive systems," "genetic algorithms," and "cellular automata."

虽然这三次爆发都关注复杂性，但他们选择了复杂性的不同方面来特别关注。第一次世界大战后对复杂性的兴趣，侧重于整体超越部分之和的说法，具有强烈的反还原论色彩。第二次世界大战后的爆发在还原论问题上相当中立，侧重于反馈和体内平衡（自我稳定）在维持复杂系统中的作用。当前对复杂性的兴趣主要集中在 创造和维持复杂性的机制以及描述和分析复杂性的分析工具。

While sharing a concern with complexity, the three eruptions selected different aspects of the complex for special attention. The post-WWI interest in complexity, focusing on the claim that the whole transcends the sum of the parts, was strongly anti-reductionist in flavor. The post-WWII outburst was rather neutral on the issue of reductionism, focusing on the roles of feedback and homeostasis (self-stabilization) in maintaining complex systems. The current interest in complexity focuses mainly on mechanisms that create and sustain complexity and on analytic tools for describing and analyzing it.

整体论和还原论！！

Holism and Reductionist!!

“整体论”是一个非常古老的思想的现代名称。正如其创始人南非政治家和哲学家 JC Smuts 所说：

"Holism" is a modern name for a very old idea. In the words of its author, the South African statesman and philosopher, J. C. Smuts:

（整体论）将自然对象视为整体……它将自然视为由离散的、具体的物体和事物组成……[它们]不能完全分解为各个部分；……它们大于其各部分之和，机械地拼凑各部分不会产生它们，也不会解释它们的特征和行为。1

(Holism] regards natural objects as wholes. ... It looks upon nature as consisting of discrete, concrete bodies and things . . . [which] are not entirely resolvable into parts; and . . . which are more then the sums of their parts, and the mechanical putting together of their parts will not produce them or account for their characters and behavior.1

整体论可以有较弱或较强的解释。应用于生命系统时，强烈主张“将各部分组合在一起不会产生它们或解释它们的特征和行为”意味着一种与现代分子生物学完全对立的活力论。特别应用于思维时，它既用于支持机器无法思考的说法，也用于支持思考涉及的不仅仅是神经元的排列和行为的说法。应用于一般复杂系统时，它假定了系统组件中没有的新系统属性和子系统之间的关系；因此它要求出现，即“创造性”原则。机械解释出现的说法被拒绝。

Holism can be given weaker or stronger interpretations. Applied to living systems, the strong claim that "the putting together of their parts will not produce them or account for their characters and behaviors" implies a vitalism that is wholly antithetical to modern molecular biology. Applied to minds in particular, it is used to support both the claim that machines cannot think and the claim that thinking involves more than the arrangement and behavior of neurons. Applied to complex systems in general, it postulates new system properties and relations among subsystems that had no place in the system components; hence it calls for emergence, a "creative" principle. Mechanistic explanations of emergence are rejected.

更弱的解释是，涌现仅仅意味着一个复杂系统的各个部分之间存在相互关系，而这些关系在孤立系统中并不存在。因此，只有当两个或多个物体相互作用时，物体之间才会产生引力。我们可以了解双星的（相对）引力加速度，但无法了解孤立恒星的引力加速度。

In a weaker interpretation, emergence simply means that the parts of a complex system have mutual relations that do not exist for the parts in isolation. Thus, there can be gravitational attractions among bodies only when two or more bodies interact with each other. We can learn something about the (relative) gravitational accelerations of binary stars, but not of isolated stars.

同样，如果我们只研究单个蛋白质的结构，就无法预示一个蛋白质分子作为酶如何提供模板，其他两个分子可以插入其中并在发生反应时被抓住。模板是酶的一个真实物理属性，只有在被置于某种其他分子的环境中时才起作用。

In the same way, if we study the structures only of individual proteins, nothing presages the way in which one protein molecule, serving as an enzyme, can provide a template into which two other molecules can insert themselves and be held while they undergo a reaction linking them. The template, a real enough physical property of the enzyme, has no function until it is placed in an environment of other molecules of a certain kind.

1. JC Smuts，《整体论》， 《大英百科全书》 ，第 14 版，第 11 卷（1929 年），第 640 页。

1. J. C. Smuts, "Holism," Encyclopaedia Britannica, 14th ed., vol. 11 (1929), p. 640.

尽管模板的功能是“突现的”，对分离的酶分子毫无意义，但结合过程及其所用的力量可以根据参与其中的分子的已知物理化学性质得到完全还原性的解释。因此，这种弱的突现形式对即使是最热心的还原论者来说也不成问题。

Even though the template's function is "emergent," having no meaning for the isolated enzyme molecule, the binding process, and the forces employed in it, can be given a wholly reductionist explanation in terms of the known physico-chemical properties of the molecules that participate in it. Consequently, this weak form of emergence poses no problems for even the most ardent reductionist.

“弱涌现”以多种方式出现。在描述复杂系统时，我们经常发现引入新的理论术语很方便，例如力学中的惯性质量或电路理论中的电压，这些术语表示不可直接观察但由可观察量之间的关系定义的量。2我们通常可以使用此类术语来避免提及组成子系统的细节，而仅提及它们的总体属性。

"Weak emergence" shows up in a variety of ways. In describing a complex system we often find it convenient to introduce new theoretical terms, like inertial mass in mechanics, or voltage in the theory of circuits, for quantities that are not directly observable but are defined by relations among the observables.2 We can often use such terms to avoid reference to details of the component subsystems, referring only to their aggregate properties.

例如，欧姆通过构建一个电路建立了电阻定律，该电路包含一个驱动电流通过导线的电池和一个测量电流感应的磁力的电流表。通过改变导线的长度，他改变了电流。将导线长度（电阻）与电流表记录的力（电流）联系起来的方程包含两个常数，这两个常数与导线长度无关，但如果他用另一个电池替换电池，它们就会改变。这些常数被称为电池的电压和内阻，否则电池就不会被分析并被视为“黑匣子”。电压和内阻不是直接测量的，而是理论术语，是借助欧姆定律从测量的电阻和电流推断出来的。

Ohm, for example, established his law of electrical resistance by constructing a circuit containing a battery that drove current through a wire, and an ammeter that measured the magnetic force induced by the current. By changing the length of the wire, he altered the current. The equation relating the length of the wire (resistance) to the force registered by the ammeter (current) contained two constants, which were independent of the length of the wire but changed if he replaced the battery by another. These constants were labeled the voltage and internal resistance of the battery, which was otherwise unanalyzed and treated as a "black box." Voltage and internal resistance are not measured directly but are theoretical terms, inferred from the measured resistance and current with the aid of Ohm's Law.

在研究整个系统中各组成部分的相互作用时，常常可以忽略其细节，而各个子系统的短期行为常常可以详细描述，同时忽略子系统之间的（较慢的）相互作用。在经济学中，我们经常研究密切相关的市场之间的相互作用——例如，铁矿石、生铁、钢板和钢铁产品市场——假设所有其他供需关系保持不变。在下一章中，我们将详细讨论这种近乎独立的层级结构 系统与其组成子系统的细节之间的独立性，以及子系统与整个系统较慢运动之间的短期独立性。

Whereas the details of components can often be ignored while studying their interactions in the whole system, the short-run behavior of the individual subsystems can often be described in detail while ignoring the (slower) interactions among subsystems. In economics, we often study the interaction of closely related markets—for example, the markets for iron ore, pig iron, sheet steel and steel products—under the assumption that all other supply and demand relations remain constant. In the next chapter, we will discuss at length this near independence of hierarchical systems from the detail of their component subsystems, as well as the short-run independence of the subsystems from the slower movements of the total system.

2. HA Simon，“物理理论的公理化”，科学哲学， 37 （ 1970），16-26。

2. H. A. Simon, "The Axiomatization of Physical Theories," Philosophy of Science, 37(1970), 16-26.

通过采用这种对涌现的弱解释，我们可以在原则上坚持（我将坚持）还原论，尽管从对部分属性的了解中严格推断整体属性并不容易（通常甚至在计算上也不可行）。通过这种务实的方式，我们可以为每个连续的复杂程度建立几乎独立的理论，但同时，建立桥接理论，展示如何根据下一级别的元素和关系来解释每个更高级别。

By adopting this weak interpretation of emergence, we can adhere (and I will adhere) to reductionism in principle even though it is not easy (often not even computationally feasible) to infer rigorously the properties of the whole from knowledge of the properties of the parts. In this pragmatic way, we can build nearly independent theories for each successive level of complexity, but at the same time, build bridging theories that show how each higher level can be accounted for in terms of the elements and relations of the next level below.

当然，这是科学的通常概念，即从基本粒子、原子和分子到细胞、器官和生物体，科学的发展都是向上的。然而，实际的历史往往是朝着相反的方向展开的——自上而下。我们已经在第一章中观察到，我们通常如何把我们的科学理论挂在天钩上。

This is, of course, the usual conception of the sciences as building upward from elementary particles, through atoms and molecules to cells, organs and organisms. The actual history, however, has unfolded, as often as not, in the opposite direction—from top down. We have already observed, in chapter 1, how we commonly hang our scientific theories from skyhooks.

控制论和一般系统理论

Cybernetics and General Systems Theory

第二次世界大战期间及战后不久，诺伯特·维纳 (Norbert Wiener) 称之为“控制论”的理论应运而生：它结合了伺服机制理论（反馈控制系统）、信息论和现代存储程序计算机，所有这些都为复杂性提供了大胆的新见解。信息论从熵（无序性）减少的角度来解释有组织的复杂性，当系统（例如生物体）从外部来源吸收能量并将其转化为模式或结构时，熵（无序性）就会减少。在信息论中，能量、信息和模式都对应于负熵。

The period during and just after World War II saw the emergence of what Norbert Wiener dubbed "cybernetics": a combination of servomechanism theory (feedback control systems), information theory, and modern stored-program computers, all of which afford bold new insights into complexity. Information theory explains organized complexity in terms of the reduction of entropy (disorder) that is achieved when systems (organisms, for example) absorb energy from external sources and convert it to pattern or structure. In information theory, energy, information, and pattern all correspond to negative entropy.

反馈控制显示了系统如何朝着目标努力并适应不断变化的环境，3从而揭开了目的论的神秘面纱。所需要的是能够识别目标、检测当前情况与目标之间的差异以及可以减少这种差异的行动：这正是通用问题求解器等系统所体现的能力。很快，这种洞察力就被应用于 建造可以在房间内自主移动的小型机器人。4随着计算机的出现，人们可以建造出复杂程度前所未有地高的系统；计算机凭借其解释和执行内部存储程序的能力，开创了人工智能的研究。

Feedback control shows how a system can work toward goals and adapt to a changing environment,3 thereby removing the mystery from teleology. What is required is ability to recognize the goal, to detect differences between the current situation and the goal, and actions that can reduce such differences: precisely the capabilities embodied in a system like the General Problem Solver. Soon this insight was being applied to constructing small robots that could maneuver around a room autonomously.4 As computers became available, systems could be built at levels of complexity that had never before been contemplated; and by virtue of their capability for interpreting and executing their own internally stored programs, computers initiated the study of artificial intelligence.

3. A.Rosenblueth，N.Wiener和J.Bigelow，《行为、目的和目的论》，《科学哲学》，10 （ 1943），18-24。

3. A. Rosenblueth, N. Wiener and J. Bigelow, "Behavior, Purpose and Teleology," Philosophy of Science, 10(1943), 18-24.

这些发展既促进了对复杂系统（尤其是适应性目标导向系统）“整体”的研究，也促进了从机制角度对系统属性进行还原性解释。整体论与还原论的对抗是前所未有的，这种对抗在今天的人工系统哲学讨论中仍在继续。

These developments encouraged both the study of complex systems, especially adaptive goal-oriented systems, "as wholes," and simultaneously, the reductive explanation of system properties in terms of mechanisms. Holism was brought into confrontation with reductionism in a way that had never been possible before, and that confrontation continues today in philosophical discussion of artificial systems.

在战后的这些年里，提出了许多发展“一般系统理论”的建议，这些理论从物理、生物或社会系统的特殊属性中抽象出来，适用于所有系统。5我们可能会觉得，虽然这个目标值得称赞，但很难指望这些不同类型的系统具有任何共同的非平凡属性。隐喻和类比可能有用，也可能误导人。一切都取决于隐喻捕捉到的相似之处是重要的还是肤浅的。

During these postwar years, a number of proposals were advanced for the development of "general systems theory," that, abstracting from the special properties of physical, biological, or social systems, would apply to all of them.5 We might well feel that, while the goal is laudable, systems of these diverse kinds could hardly be expected to have any nontrivial properties in common. Metaphor and analogy can be helpful or they can be misleading. All depends on whether the similarities the metaphor captures are significant or superficial.

如果一般系统理论的目标过于宏大，那么在各种复杂系统中寻找共同属性可能仍然不无道理。控制论的思想即使不是一种理论，至少也是一种观点，这种观点在广泛的应用中被证明是卓有成效的。6从反馈和体内平衡的角度来看待自适应系统的行为并将选择性信息理论应用于这些概念是非常有用的。7反馈的概念 和信息为观察各种各样的情况提供了参考框架，就像进化论、相对主义、公理方法和操作主义的思想一样。

If a general systems theory is too ambitious a goal, it might still not be vain to search for common properties among broad classes of complex systems. The ideas that go by the name of cybernetics constitute, if not a theory, at least a point of view that has proved fruitful over a wide range of applications.6 It has been highly useful to look at the behavior of adaptive systems in terms of feedback and homeostasis and to apply to these concepts the theory of selective information.7 The concepts of feedback and information provide a frame of reference for viewing a wide range of situations, just as do the ideas of evolution, of relativism, of axiomatic method, and of operationalism.

4. W. Grey Walter，《生命的模仿》，《科学美国人》182（5）（1950）：42。

4. W. Grey Walter, "An Imitation of Life," Scientific American, 182(5) (1950):42.

5. 特别参阅一般系统研究学会年鉴。一般系统理论的杰出代表有 L. von Bertalanffy、K. Boulding、RW Gerard 以及至今仍活跃于这一领域的 JG Miller。

5. See especially the yearbooks of the Society for General Systems Research. Prominent exponents of general systems theory were L. von Bertalanffy, K. Boulding, R. W. Gerard and, still active in this endeavor, J. G. Miller.

6. N. Wiener，《控制论》（纽约：Wiley，1948 年）。想看富有想象力的先驱，请参阅 AJ Lotka 的《数学生物学要素》（纽约：Dover Publications，1951 年），该书于 1924 年首次出版，名为《物理生物学要素》。

6. N. Wiener, Cybernetics (New York: Wiley, 1948). For an imaginative forerunner, see A. J. Lotka, Elements of Mathematical Biology (New York: Dover Publications, 1951), first published in 1924 as Elements of Physical Biology.

7. C. Shannon 和 W. Weaver， 《通信的数学理论》（厄巴纳：伊利诺伊大学出版社，1949 年）；WR Ashby，《大脑的设计》（纽约：威利出版社，1952 年）。

7. C. Shannon and W. Weaver, The Mathematical Theory of Communication (Urbana: University of Illinois Press, 1949); W. R. Ashby, Design for a Brain (New York: Wiley, 1952).

第二波对复杂性的探究的主要贡献恰恰在于它引起了人们的注意的更具体的概念，而不是一般系统理论的宽泛思想。下一章将阐述这一观点，该章重点关注结构分层的特定复杂系统的特性，并得出强层次假设（或我将称之为近可分解性）对系统行为的影响。

The principal contribution of this second wave of inquiry into complexity lay precisely in the more specific concepts it brought to attention rather than in the broad idea of a general systems theory. This view is illustrated in the next chapter, which focuses on the properties of those particular complex systems that are hierarchical in structure, and draws out the consequences for system behavior of the strong assumption of hierarchy (or near-decomposability, as I shall call it).

当前对复杂性的兴趣

Current Interest in Complexity

当前，第三次对复杂性的关注与第二次浪潮有许多共同之处。其主要动机是人们越来越需要了解和应对世界上的一些大型系统——环境、人类创造的全球社会以及生物体。但是，如果没有新颖的思维方式，这种动机本身无法长时间吸引人们对复杂性的关注。除了第二次浪潮中出现的工具和概念之外，还出现了其他新的想法，以及相关的数学和计算算法。这些想法被称为“灾难”、“混乱”、“遗传算法”和“细胞自动机”。

The current, third, burst of interest in complexity shares many of the characteristics of the second. Much of the motivation for it is the growing need to understand and cope with some of the world's large-scale systems—the environment, for one, the world-wide society that our species has created, for another, and organisms, for a third. But this motivation could not, by itself, tie attention to complexity for very long if novel ways of thinking about it were not also provided. Going beyond the tools and concepts that appeared in the second wave, other new ideas have emerged, together with relevant mathematics and computational algorithms. The ideas have such labels as "catastrophe," "chaos," "genetic algorithms," and "cellular automata."

一如既往，这些标签倾向于具有自己的生命力。“灾难”和“混乱”的不祥语气反映了这些概念被命名时的焦虑时代。然而，它们作为概念的价值并不取决于它们所引起的修辞，而是取决于它们对复杂问题提供具体答案的能力。对于上面列出的特定概念，大部分判决尚未出炉。我想对它们中的每一个进行简要评论，因为它们既是我将在下一章中开发的分层复杂性方法的替代方案，也是补充。

As always, the labels have some tendency to assume a life of their own. The foreboding tone of "catastrophe" and "chaos" says something about the age of anxiety in which these concepts were named. Their value as concepts, however, depends not on the rhetoric they evoke, but on their power to produce concrete answers to questions of complexity. For the particular concepts listed above, much of the verdict is not yet in. I want to comment briefly on each of them, for they are both alternatives and complements to the approach to hierarchical complexity that I will develop in the next chapter.

灾变理论

Catastrophe Theory

突变理论于 1968 年左右出现，引起了轰动，但在几年内几乎淡出了公众的视线。它是一门坚实的数学，根据非线性动态系统的行为模式对其进行分类。突变事件发生在一种特殊的系统中。这样的系统可以假设两个（或更多）不同的稳定状态（例如静态平衡或周期性循环）；但是当系统处于其中一种状态时，系统参数的适度变化可能会导致它突然转移到另一种状态，或者进入变量无限增加的不稳定状态。数学家 R. Thorn 根据二变量和三变量系统可能经历或不可能经历的突变类型，对它们进行了拓扑分类。

Catastrophe theory appeared on the scene around 1968,8 made an audible splash, and nearly faded from public sight within a few years. It is a solid body of mathematics dealing with the classification of nonlinear dynamic systems according to their modes of behavior. Catastrophic events occur in a special kind of system. Such a system can assume two (or more) distinct steady states (static equilibria, for example, or periodic cycles); but when the system is in one of these states, a moderate change in a system parameter may cause it to shift suddenly to the other—or into an unstable state in which variables increase without limit. The mathematician R. Thorn constructed a topological classification of two-variable and three-variable systems according to the kinds of catastrophes they could or couldn't experience.

不难想象自然系统会表现出这种行为——稳定行为之后突然转变为不平衡或另一种完全不同的平衡。一个常被引用的例子是受到威胁的狗要么突然发起攻击，要么惊慌失措地逃跑。人们研究过更复杂的例子：例如，一群寄生在云杉林中的芽虫。快速繁殖的芽虫很快达到最大密度的平衡；但云杉林缓慢持续的生长逐渐改变了芽虫种群的极限，直到超过临界森林密度时，种群就会爆发。9人们可以想象出体现类似机制的人类革命模型。

It is not hard to think of natural systems that exhibit behavior of this kind—stable behavior followed by a sudden shift to disequilibrium or to another, quite different, equilibrium. A commonly cited example is the threatened dog that either suddenly moves to the attack—or panics and flees. More complex examples have been studied: for instance, a budworm population infesting a spruce forest. The rapidly reproducing budworms quickly reach an equilibrium of maximum density; but the slow continuing growth of the spruce forest gradually alters the limit on the budworm population until, when a critical forest density is exceeded, the population explodes.9 One can conjure up models of human revolutions embodying similar mechanisms.

在产生这种现象的情况下，灾难机制是有效的，比喻也令人回味，但在实践中，只有有限数量的情况可以导致进一步的分析。大多数最初引起公众兴趣的应用（如攻击/逃跑的狗）都是事后对现象的解释，这些现象 已经为人所熟知。因此，与二十五年前相比，突变理论在当今公众和复杂性文献中的知名度大大降低。

In the circumstances that create it, the catastrophe mechanism is effective and the metaphor evocative, but in practice, only a limited number of situations have been found where it leads to any further analysis. Most of the initial applications that struck public fancy (like the attacking/ fleeing dog) were after-the-fact explanations of phenomenon that were already familiar. For this reason, catastrophe theory is much less prominent in the public eye and in the literature of complexity today than it was twenty-five years ago.

8. 参见 R. Thorn，《模型一般理论概要》（马萨诸塞州雷丁：本杰明，1975 年）。

8. See R. Thorn, An Outline of a General Theory of Models (Reading, MA: Benjamin, 1975).

9. 有关云杉/芽虫模型的说明，请参阅 TFH Allen 和 TB Starr 的《生态学：生态复杂性的视角》（伊利诺伊州芝加哥：芝加哥大学出版社，1982 年）及其引用的参考文献。在下一章中，我们将看到，这个相同的例子可以描述为一个几乎可分解的系统。

9. For an account of the spruce/budworm model, see T. F. H. Allen and T. B. Starr, Ecology: Perspectives for Ecological Complexity (Chicago, IL: University of Chicago Press, 1982), and references cited there. In the next chapter we will see that this same example can be described as a nearly decomposable system.

复杂性和混乱性

Complexity and Chaos

混沌理论也代表着坚实的数学，其历史可以追溯到庞加莱时期。10混沌系统是确定性的动态系统，如果其初始条件受到哪怕是极小的干扰，也可能会彻底改变其路径。因此，尽管它们是确定性的，但它们随时间变化的详细行为是不可预测的，因为微小的扰动会导致路径发生巨大变化。混沌系统很难用数学方法处理，尽管一些法国数学家按照庞加莱的传统继续研究这个课题，但直到本世纪中叶以后，这一课题才取得了一些进展。新进展的主要来源是能够使用计算机显示和探索其混沌行为。

The theory of chaos also represents solid mathematics, which in this case has a long history reaching back to Poincare.10 Chaotic systems are deterministic dynamic systems that, if their initial conditions are disturbed even infinitesimally, may alter their paths radically. Thus, although they are deterministic, their detailed behavior over time is unpredictable, for small perturbations cause large changes in path. Chaotic systems were sufficiently intractable to mathematical treatment that, although the subject was kept alive by a few French mathematicians working in the tradition of Poincare, only modest progress was made with them until well beyond the middle of this century. A major source of new progress has been the ability to use computers to display and explore their chaotic behavior.

渐渐地，许多科学领域的研究人员开始怀疑，他们希望了解的重要现象，从技术意义上讲，是混沌的。最早的研究人员之一是气象学家 EN Lorenz，他于 20 世纪 60 年代初开始探索天气是一种混沌现象的可能性——新加坡的蝴蝶扇动翅膀可能会导致纽约的雷暴。很快，人们开始以混沌的形式讨论流体湍流；人们开始研究混沌在各种物理和生物系统的复杂行为中可能的作用。20 世纪 70 年代末，开始出现确凿的实验证据表明，特定的物理系统确实表现出混沌行为。”

Gradually, researchers in a number of sciences began to suspect that important phenomena they wished to understand were, in this technical sense, chaotic. One of the first was the meteorologist E. N. Lorenz, who started to explore in the early 1960s the possibility that weather was a chaotic phenomenon—the possibility that the butterfly in Singapore, by flapping its wings, could cause a thunderstorm in New York. Soon, fluid turbulence in general was being discussed in terms of chaos; and the possible inculpation of chaos in the complex behavior of a wide range of physical and biological systems was being studied. Solid experimental evidence that specific physical systems do, in fact, behave chaotically began to appear in the late 1970s."

人们对混乱的关注度不断增长，我们必须从我们这个时代的背景来看待了解动态系统。长期以来，我们已经有一个相当普遍的线性系统理论微分方程方程及其闭式解。对于非线性方程组，情况就不那么令人满意了。在特定的简单边界条件下，已知许多重要的非线性偏微分方程组的解，这些方程组可以捕捉各种波动的规律。但除了这些特殊情况之外，知识仅限于定性分析局部行为（其稳定性或不稳定性）的方法，以便将可实现状态的空间划分为离散区域。在每个这样的区域中，都会发生特定类型的行为（例如，向平衡运动、脱离不稳定平衡、极限环中的稳态运动）。12

The growth in attention to chaos must be viewed against the background of our general understanding of dynamic systems. For a long time we have had a quite general theory of systems of linear differential equations and their solution in closed form. With systems of nonlinear equations, matters were less satisfactory. Under particular simple boundary conditions, solutions were known for a number of important systems of nonlinear partial differential equations that capture the laws of various kinds of wave motion. But beyond these special cases, knowledge was limited to methods for analyzing local behavior qualitatively—its stability or instability—in order to divide the space of achievable states into discrete regions. In each such region, specific kinds of behavior (e.g., movement to equilibrium, escape from unstable equilibrium, steady-state motion in limit cycles) would occur.12

10. H. Poincare，《天上机械的新方法》。（巴黎：Gauthier-Villars，1892）。

10. H. Poincare, Les Methodes Nouvelle de la Mecbanique Celeste. (Paris: Gauthier-Villars, 1892).

11. 在 P. Cvitanovic 主编的《混沌的普遍性》 （布里斯托尔：Adam Hilger，1986 年）中可以找到截至 20 世纪 80 年代中期关于混沌的优秀文献选集，包括数学和实验文献。

11. An excellent selection of the literature of chaos, both mathematical and experimental, up to the middle 1980s can be found in P. Cvitanovic (ed.), Universality in Chaos (Bristol: Adam Hilger, 1986).

这是标准教科书处理非线性分析的基本内容，除了这些定性概括之外，复杂的非线性系统必须主要通过计算机的数值模拟来研究。过去半个世纪的大多数大型计算机和超级计算机都忙于用数字模拟描述飞机、原子堆、大气和湍流系统动力学的偏微分方程系统的行为。由于教科书通常不讨论混沌系统，因此当时的非线性系统理论对处理诸如湍流之类的现象几乎没有帮助，除非是在总体和非常近似的层面上。

This was the bread-and-butter content of the standard textbook treatments of nonlinear analysis, and beyond these qualitative generalizations, complex nonlinear systems had to be studied mainly by numerical simulation with computers. Most of the large computers and super-computers of the past half century have been kept busy simulating numerically the behavior of the systems of partial differential equations that describe the dynamics of airplanes, atomic piles, the atmosphere, and turbulent systems generally. As chaotic systems were not typically discussed in the textbooks, the then-current theory of nonlinear systems provided little help in treating such phenomena as turbulence except at an aggregate and very approximate level.

在这种情况下，20 世纪 70 年代末和 80 年代初计算机产生的有关混沌的新发现，在各个领域引起了极大的兴趣和兴奋，这些领域的现象已经被怀疑是混沌现象，因此也许可以用新理论更好地理解这些现象。对简单非线性系统的数值计算揭示了意想不到的不变量（“普适数”），这些不变量可以预测此类系统的广泛类别在什么时候会从有序行为转变为混沌行为。”在高速计算机出现以揭示这些规律之前，这些规律是看不见的。

Under these circumstances, new computer-generated discoveries about chaos in the late 1970s and early 1980s created enormous interest and excitement in a variety of fields where phenomena were already suspected of being chaotic, and hence could perhaps be understood better with the new theory. Numerical computations on simple nonlinear systems revealed unsuspected invariants ("universal numbers") that predicted, for broad classes of such systems, at what point they would change from orderly to chaotic behavior." Until high-speed computers were available to reveal them, such regularities were invisible.

12. 标准来源是 AA Andronov、EA Leontovich、II Gordon 和 AG Maier 的《二阶动态系统的定性理论》（Wiley，NY：1973 年）。

12. A standard source is A. A. Andronov, E. A. Leontovich, I. I. Gordon and A. G. Maier, Qualitative Theory of Second-Order Dynamic Systems (Wiley, NY: 1973).

13. MJ Feigenbaum，《非线性系统的普遍行为》，洛斯阿拉莫斯科学， 1（1980）：4-27。这篇论文和 20 世纪 70 年代和 80 年代关于混沌的其他“经典”论文均转载于 P. Cvitanovic 主编的上文。

13. M. J. Feigenbaum, "Universal Behavior in Nonlinear Systems," Los Alamos Science, l(1980):4-27. This and other "classic" papers on chaos from the 1970s and 1980s are reprinted in P. Cvitanovic, ed., op. cit.

如今，人们对混沌的许多方面已经取得了深刻的理解，但说我们“理解”并不意味着我们可以预测。混沌导致人们认识到一种新的、广义的平衡概念——所谓的“奇异吸引子”。在经典非线性理论中，系统可能达到稳定平衡，也可能像行星轨道一样在极限环中永久振荡。然而，混沌系统也可能进入其状态空间的一个区域，即奇异吸引子，并永久停留在该区域。

Deep understanding has now been achieved of many aspects of chaos, but to say that we "understand" does not imply that we can predict. Chaos led to the recognition of a new, generalized, notion of equilibrium—the so-called "strange attractor." In classical nonlinear theory a system might come to a stable equilibrium, or it might oscillate permanently in a limit cycle, like the orbit of a planet. A chaotic system, however, might also enter a region of its state space, the strange attractor, in which it would remain permanently.

在奇异吸引子中，运动不会停止，也不会可预测，但尽管是确定性的，但似乎是随机的。也就是说，进入奇异吸引子的方向略有不同，或者在其中受到轻微扰动，都会导致系统进入完全不同的路径。一颗台球以 45° 角精确瞄准方形“理想”台球桌，它会从连续的侧面反射回来，回到起点，无限重复其矩形路径。但如果你将 45° 角减小或增加一个 epsilon，球将永远不会回到起点，而是会沿着一条路径最终尽可能靠近桌子上的任意位置。桌子的整个表面已成为混沌行为的奇异吸引子，几乎相等但不同的初始角度会产生不断发散的路径。

Within the strange attractor, motion would not cease, nor would it be predictable, but although deterministic, would appear to be random. That is, slightly different directions of entrance into the strange attractor, or slight perturbations when in it, would lead the system into quite different paths. A billiard ball aimed exactly at a 45° angle across a square "ideal" billiard table, will reflect off successive sides and, returning to the starting point, repeat its rectangular path indefinitely. But if you decrease or increase the 45° angle by an epsilon, the ball will never return to the starting point but will pursue a path that will eventually take it as close as you please to any spot on the table. The table's entire surface has become the strange attractor for the chaotic behavior and almost equal but different initial angles will produce continually diverging paths.

混沌理论可能没有保持 20 世纪 60 年代初至 80 年代末的迅猛发展速度，但在此期间，它已成为研究一系列系统的重要概念框架和数学工具，这些系统在许多科学领域具有重大的现实意义。混沌机制比突变理论的机制更普遍，应用范围也更广。因此，我们可以预期，在复杂系统的持续研究中，混沌将继续发挥比突变更大的作用。

The theory of chaos has perhaps not maintained the hectic pace of development it experienced from the early 1960s to the late 1980s, but during this period it established itself as an essential conceptual framework and mathematical tool for the study of a class of systems that have major real-world importance in a number of scientific domains. The mechanisms of chaos are more general, but also of wider application, than those of catastrophe theory. Hence, we can expect chaos to continue to play a larger role than catastrophe in the continuing study of complex systems.

灾难或混乱世界中的理性

Rationality in a Catastrophic or Chaotic World

灾难和混乱对我们在前六章中讨论的系统（经济、人类思维和设计的复杂系统）有何影响？尽管曾有人试图在经济时间序列中发现混乱，但迄今为止结果尚无定论。据我所知，没有明确的证据表明混乱 大脑中存在混乱，但越来越多的证据表明，混乱在正常和有缺陷的心脏功能中发挥着作用，尽管这种作用目前仍不太清楚。设计师经常构建能够产生并成功应对湍流和其他类型混乱的系统（例如飞机和轮船）。

What implications do catastrophe and chaos have for the systems—economies, the human mind, and designed complex systems—that we have been discussing in the previous six chapters? Although there have been some attempts to discover chaos in economic time series, the results thus far have been inconclusive. I am aware of no clear demonstration of chaos in the brain, but there is increasing evidence that chaos plays a role, although still a rather unclear one, in the functioning of the normal and defective heart. Designers frequently construct systems (e.g., airplanes and ships) that produce, and cope successfully with, turbulence and perhaps other kinds of chaos.

根据这些证据，我们既不应该假设我们在世界上遇到的所有复杂系统都是混乱的，也不应该假设其中只有极少数是混乱的。此外，正如飞机的例子所示，不祥的术语“混乱”不应被理解为“难以管理”。湍流经常出现在液压和空气动力学情况和制品中。在这种情况下，尽管未来在任何细节上都无法预测，但它作为一种总体现象是可以管理的。众所周知，龙卷风和飓风的路径不稳定，但在短期内足够稳定，我们通常可以在它们袭击我们之前得到警告并到达避难所。

On the basis of the evidence, we should suppose neither that all of the complex systems we encounter in the world are chaotic, nor that few of them are. Moreover, as the airplane example shows, the ominous term "chaotic" should not be read as "unmanageable." Turbulence is frequently present in hydraulic and aerodynamic situations and artifacts. In such situations, although the future is not predictable in any detail, it is manageable as an aggregate phenomenon. And the paths of tornadoes and hurricanes are notoriously unstable but stable enough in the short run that we can usually be warned and reach shelter before they hit us.

自牛顿以来，天文学家已经能够计算出两个相互产生引力的天体系统的运动。对于三个或更多天体，他们从未获得超过近似值的运动，事实上，现在有充分的理由相信，一般来说，包括太阳系在内的三个或更多天体的引力系统是混乱的。但我们没有理由预见这种混乱会带来不良后果——它的存在只是意味着天文学家在相当长的一段时间内无法预测行星的准确位置——这种困惑与气象学家预测天气时遇到的困难一样令人沮丧，但可能没有那么严重。

Since Newton, astronomers have been able to compute the motion of a system of two bodies that exercise mutual gravitational attraction on each other. With three or more bodies, they never obtained more than approximations to the motion, and indeed, there is now good reason to believe that, in general, gravitational systems of three or more bodies, including the solar system, are chaotic. But we have no reason to anticipate untoward consequences from that chaos—its presence simply implies that astronomers will be frustrated in their attempts to predict the exact positions of the planets in the rather long run—a perplexity as frustrating as, but perhaps less damaging than, the difficulties meteorologists experience in predicting the weather.

最后，在设计反馈装置方面取得了重大进展，这种装置通过将混沌系统限制在具有所需属性的小邻域内（在其奇异吸引子内移动），从而将混沌“驯服”，从而使混沌变为仅可容忍的噪声。与前面章节中的讨论一致，此类装置提供了一个用控制代替预测的例子。

Finally, there has been substantial progress in devising feedback devices that "tame" chaos by restricting chaotic systems, moving within their strange attractors, to small neighborhoods having desired properties, so that the chaos becomes merely tolerable noise. Such devices provide an example, consonant with the discussion in earlier chapters, of the substitution of control for prediction.

复杂性与演化

Complexity and Evolution

目前对复杂系统的研究大多集中于复杂性的本质，即系统演化。两种计算方法在进化过程中，特别受到关注的是霍兰德 (Holland) 14 首次探索的遗传算法，以及模拟生物体繁殖和竞争的细胞自动机的计算机算法，即所谓的“生命游戏”。

Much current research on complex systems focuses upon the emergence of complexity, that is, system evolution. Two computational approaches to evolution that have attracted particular attention are the genetic algorithms first explored by Holland14 and computer algorithms for cellular automata that simulate the multiplication and competition of organisms, playing the so-called "game of life."

遗传算法。从进化的角度来看，生物体可以用特征列表或向量（其基因）来表示。进化根据生存适应性来评估这个向量。一代又一代，物种成员的特征及其组合的频率分布通过有性生殖、交叉、倒位和突变而发生变化。自然选择导致有助于高适应性的特征和特征组合比有利于低适应性的特征和组合更快地繁殖，并最终取代它们。

Genetic Algorithms. From an evolutionary standpoint, an organism can be represented by a list or vector of features (its genes). Evolution evaluates this vector in terms of fitness for survival. From generation to generation, the frequency distribution of features and their combinations over the members of a species change through sexual reproduction, crossover, inversion, and mutation. Natural selection causes features and combinations of features contributing to high fitness to multiply more rapidly than, and ultimately to replace, features and combinations conducive to low fitness.

通过在现代计算机上对这一抽象概念进行编程，我们可以构建进化过程的计算模型。反过来，该模拟可用于研究在不同的模型假设（包括突变率和交叉率假设）下适应度增长的相对速率。在下一章中，我们将考虑分层系统中进化的特殊情况，这种系统似乎是自然界中占主导地位的系统。

By programming this abstraction on a modern computer we can build a computational model of the process of evolution. The simulation, in turn, can be used to study the relative rates at which fitness will grow under different assumptions about the model, including assumptions about rates of mutation and crossover. In the next chapter, we will consider the special case of evolution in hierarchical systems, which appears to be the kind of system that predominates in the natural world.

细胞自动机和生命游戏。计算机不仅用于估计进化的统计数据，还用于在抽象层面上模拟进化过程。事实上，这项研究可以追溯到第二次世界大战后人们对复杂性的兴趣爆发，当时约翰·冯·诺依曼基于一些想法斯坦尼斯拉夫·乌拉姆抽象地定义了（但没有实现）一个能够自我复制的系统。这个想法被亚瑟·伯克斯和其他人保留了下来，但直到现在的活动时期，克里斯托弗·兰顿才创建了一个模拟自我复制细胞自动机的计算机程序。计算机程序可以创建 各种符号对象，并根据其环境（包括其他附近对象）应用复制或销毁规则。通过适当选择系统参数，此类模拟可以生动地展示自我复制系统的演变。这一探索方向仍处于非常早期的发展阶段，很大程度上依赖于计算机模拟，缺乏任何大型形式理论。我们还需要一段时间才能评估其潜力，但它已经为我们提供了一个基本而令人兴奋的结果：自我复制系统是现实。

Cellular Automata and The Game of Life. The computer is used not only to estimate the statistics of evolution but to carry out simulations, at an abstract level, of evolutionary processes. This research goes back, in fact, to the second eruption of interest in complexity, after World War II, when John von Neumann, building on some ideas of Stanislaw Ulam, defined abstractly (but did not implement) a system that was capable of reproducing itself. The idea was kept alive by Arthur Burks and others, but it was not until well into the current period of activity that Christopher Langton created a computer program that simulated a self-reproducing cellular automaton.IS Computer programs can create symbolic objects of various kinds and apply rules for their replication or destruction as a function of their environments (which include other nearby objects). With appropriate selection of the system parameters, such simulations can provide vivid demonstrations of evolving selfreproducing systems. This line of exploration is still at a very early stage of development, is largely dependent on computer simulation, and lacks any large body of formal theory. It will be some time before we can assess its potential, but it has already presented us with a fundamental and exciting result: self-reproducing systems are a reality.

14. JH Holland， 《自然与人工系统的适应性》（安阿伯：密歇根大学出版社，1975年）。

14. J. H. Holland, Adaptation in Natural and Artificial Systems (Ann Arbor: University of Michigan Press, 1975).

15. AW Burks (ed.)，《细胞自动机论文集》（香槟-厄巴纳：伊利诺伊大学出版社，1970 年）；CG Langton (ed.)，《人工生命》。圣菲研究所复杂性科学研究论文集第 6 卷 (Redwood City, CA: Addison-Wesley, 1989)；CG Langton、C. Taylor、JD Farmer 和 S. Rassmussen (eds.)，人工智能生命II。圣菲研究所复杂性科学研究论文集第 10 卷 (Redwood City, CA: Addison-Wesley, 1992)。

15. A. W. Burks (ed.), Essays on Cellular Automata (Champaign-Urbana: University of Illinois Press, 1970); C. G. Langton (ed.), Artificial Life. Santa Fe Institute Studies in the Sciences of Complexity, Proceedings, vol. 6 (Redwood City, CA: Addison-Wesley, 1989); C. G. Langton, C. Taylor, J. D. Farmer and S. Rassmussen (eds.), Artificial Life II. Santa Fe Institute Studies in the Sciences of Complexity, Proceedings, vol. 10 (Redwood City, CA: Addison-Wesley, 1992).

结论

Conclusion

人们越来越认识到，复杂性是我们生活的世界和与我们共存的世界的系统的一个关键特征。科学试图理解复杂系统并不是什么新鲜事：天文学家已经研究了数千年，生物学家、经济学家、心理学家和其他人在几代人之前也加入了他们的行列。当前活动的新颖之处不在于研究特定的复杂系统，而在于研究复杂性现象本身。

Complexity is more and more acknowledged to be a key characteristic of the world we live in and of the systems that cohabit our world. It is not new for science to attempt to understand complex systems: astronomers have been at it for millennia, and biologists, economists, psychologists, and others joined them some generations ago. What is new about the present activity is not the study of particular complex systems but the study of the phenomenon of complexity in its own right.

如果复杂性（如系统科学）是一个过于笼统的课题，没有太多内容，那么具有强大特性的特定类别的复杂系统可以成为关注的焦点，这些特性为理论化和概括提供了支点。越来越多的人认为这就是正在发生的事情，混沌、遗传算法、细胞自动机、灾变和分层系统是目前可见的一些焦点。在下一章中，我们将更仔细地研究其中的最后一个。

If, as appears to be the case, complexity (like systems science) is too general a subject to have much content, then particular classes of complex systems possessing strong properties that provide a fulcrum for theorizing and generalizing can serve as the foci of attention. More and more, this appears to be just what is happening, with chaos, genetic algorithms, cellular automata, catastrophe, and hierarchical systems serving as some of the currently visible focal points. In the next chapter we will examine the last-named of these more closely.

8

8

复杂性的架构：分层系统

The Architecture of Complexity: Hierarchic Systems

在本章中，我想报告一些我们在各个科学领域遇到的特定复杂系统方面所学到的知识。我将要讨论的发展是在特定现象的背景下出现的，但理论表述本身很少涉及结构细节。相反，它们主要指所研究系统的复杂性，而没有具体说明这种复杂性的具体内容。由于这些理论的抽象性，它们可能与社会、生物和物理科学中观察到的许多复杂系统相关——应用这个词太过强烈了。

In this chapter I should like to report on some things we have been learning about particular kinds of complex systems encountered in various sciences. The developments I shall discuss arose in the context of specific phenomena, but the theoretical formulations themselves make little reference to details of structure. Instead they refer primarily to the complexity of the systems under view without specifying the exact content of that complexity. Because of their abstractness, the theories may have relevance—application would be too strong a term—to many kinds of complex systems observed in the social, biological, and physical sciences.

在叙述这些发展时，我将避免使用技术细节，因为这些细节通常可以在其他地方找到。我将在理论产生的特定背景下描述每一种理论。然后，我将引用一些复杂系统的例子，这些例子来自最初应用之外的科学领域，这些理论框架似乎与这些领域相关。在这样做时，我将提到我不熟悉的知识领域——也许甚至不识字。我相信，读者很容易就能区分出基于空想或纯粹无知的例子和那些揭示复杂性在自然界中表现方式的例子。

In recounting these developments, I shall avoid technical detail, which can generally be found elsewhere. I shall describe each theory in the particular context in which it arose. Then I shall cite some examples of complex systems, from areas of science other than the initial application, to which the theoretical framework appears relevant. In doing so, I shall make reference to areas of knowledge where I am not expert—perhaps not even literate. The reader will have little difficulty, I am sure, in distinguishing instances based on idle fancy or sheer ignorance from instances that cast some light on the ways in which complexity exhibits itself wherever it is found in nature.

我不会对“复杂系统”做出正式的定义。1粗略地说，我所说的复杂系统是指由大量 具有许多相互作用的部分。正如我们在上一章中看到的，在这样的系统中，整体大于各部分之和，这是因为，考虑到各部分的属性及其相互作用的规律，推断整体的属性并非易事。2

I shall not undertake a formal definition of "complex systems."1 Roughly, by a complex system I mean one made up of a large number of parts that have many interactions. As we saw in the last chapter, in such systems the whole is more than the sum of the parts in the weak but important pragmatic sense that, given the properties of the parts and the laws of their interaction, it is not a trivial matter to infer the properties of the whole.2

本章是对同名论文的修订，经《美国哲学学会会刊》许可转载， 106（1962 年 12 月）：467-482。

This chapter is a revision of a paper with the same title, reprinted with permission from Proceedings of the American Philosophical Society, 106(December 1962): 467-482.

1. W. Weaver 在《科学与复杂性》一书中，《美国科学家》第 36 卷（1948 年）：536 页，区分了两种复杂性：无组织的复杂性和有组织的复杂性。我们主要关注有组织的复杂性。

1. W. Weaver, in "Science and Complexity," American Scientist, 36(1948):536, has distinguished two kinds of complexity, disorganized and organized. We shall be concerned primarily with organized complexity.

接下来的四个部分讨论了复杂性的四个方面。第一部分对复杂性以层次结构形式出现的频率提出了一些评论——复杂系统由子系统组成，而子系统又有自己的子系统，依此类推。第二部分理论化了复杂系统的结构与其通过进化过程出现所需时间之间的关系；具体来说，它认为层次结构的系统将比同等规模的非层次系统进化得更快。第三部分探讨了层次组织系统的动态特性，并展示了如何将它们分解为子系统以分析其行为。第四部分研究了复杂系统与其描述之间的关系。

The four sections that follow discuss four aspects of complexity. The first offers some comments on the frequency with which complexity takes the form of hierarchy—the complex system being composed of subsystems that in turn have their own subsystems, and so on. The second section theorizes about the relation between the structure of a complex system and the time required for it to emerge through evolutionary processes; specifically it argues that hierarchic systems will evolve far more quickly than nonhierarchic systems of comparable size. The third section explores the dynamic properties of hierarchically organized systems and shows how they can be decomposed into subsystems in order to analyze their behavior. The fourth section examines the relation between complex systems and their descriptions.

因此，我的核心主题是，复杂性通常以层次结构的形式出现，层次结构系统具有一些独立于其具体内容的共同属性。我认为，层次结构是复杂性架构师使用的核心结构方案之一。

Thus my central theme is that complexity frequently takes the form of hierarchy and that hierarchic systems have some common properties independent of their specific content. Hierarchy, I shall argue, is one of the central structural schemes that the architect of complexity uses.

层次系统

Hierarchic Systems

所谓层次系统或层次结构，是指由相互关联的子系统组成的系统，每个子系统的结构依次为层次结构，直到我们到达某个最低级别的基本子系统。在自然界的大多数系统中，我们在哪里结束都是有点随意的 划分和我们把哪些子系统视为基本子系统。物理学大量使用“基本粒子”的概念，尽管粒子有一种令人不安的倾向，即不会长时间保持基本状态。仅仅几代人之前，原子本身还是基本粒子；今天，对核物理学家来说，它们是复杂的系统。对于天文学的某些目的，整个恒星，甚至星系，都可以被视为基本子系统。在一种生物学研究中，细胞可能被视为基本子系统；在另一种研究中，细胞可能被视为蛋白质分子；在另一种研究中，细胞可能被视为氨基酸残基。

By a hierarchic system, or hierarchy, I mean a system that is composed of interrelated subsystems, each of the latter being in turn hierarchic in structure until we reach some lowest level of elementary subsystem. In most systems in nature it is somewhat arbitrary as to where we leave off the partitioning and what subsystems we take as elementary. Physics makes much use of the concept of "elementary particle," although particles have a disconcerting tendency not to remain elementary very long. Only a couple of generations ago the atoms themselves were elementary particles; today to the nuclear physicist they are complex systems. For certain purposes of astronomy whole stars, or even galaxies, can be regarded as elementary subsystems. In one kind of biological research a cell may be treated as an elementary subsystem; in another, a protein molecule; in still another, an amino acid residue.

2.另见 John R. Platt 的《大分子的性质超越其化学亚群的性质》，《理论生物学杂志》， 1（1961）：342-358。由于还原论-整体论问题是科学家和人文主义者之间争斗的主要原因，也许我们甚至可能希望两种文化之间能够按照刚才建议的妥协方式达成和平。在讨论过程中，我将对艺术和自然科学中的复杂性进行一些讨论。我必须强调我的整体论的实用主义，以便将其与 WM Elsasser 在《生物学的物理基础》（纽约：Pergamon Press，1958 年）中所持的立场区分开来。

2. See also John R. Platt, "Properties of Large Molecules that Go beyond the Properties of Their Chemical Sub-groups," Journal of Theoretical Biology, l(1961):342-358. Since the reductionism-holism issue is a major cause de guerre between scientists and humanists, perhaps we might even hope that peace could be negotiated between the two cultures along the lines of the compromise just suggested. As I go along, I shall have a little to say about complexity in the arts as well as in the natural sciences. I must emphasize the pragmatism of my holism to distinguish it sharply from the position taken by W. M. Elsasser in The Physical Foundation of Biology (New York: Pergamon Press, 1958).

科学家为什么有权将实际上极其复杂的子系统视为基本子系统，这是我们要讨论的问题之一。目前，我们接受这样一个事实：科学家一直都在这样做，如果他们是谨慎的科学家，他们通常不会受到惩罚。

Just why a scientist has a right to treat as elementary a subsystem that is in fact exceedingly complex is one of the questions we shall take up. For the moment we shall accept the fact that scientists do this all the time and that, if they are careful scientists, they usually get away with it.

从词源学上讲，“等级”一词的含义比我在这里给出的要狭窄。该术语通常用于指代一个复杂系统，其中每个子系统都通过权威关系从属于它所属的系统。更确切地说，在一个等级制正式组织中，每个系统都由一个“老板”和一组下属子系统组成。每个子系统都有一个“老板”，他是系统老板的直接下属。我们要考虑子系统之间的关系比刚才描述的正式组织等级制度更复杂的系统。我们要包括子系统之间没有从属关系的系统。 （事实上​​，即使在人类组织中，正式的等级制度也只存在于纸面上；真正的有血有肉的组织除了正式的权力线之外，还有许多其他部门间关系。）由于缺乏更好的术语，我将使用前面段落中介绍的更广泛意义上的“等级制度”，以指代可分析为连续子系统集的所有复杂系统，而当我想指代更专业的概念时，我将使用“正式等级制度”。3

Erymologically the word "hierarchy" has had a narrower meaning than I am giving it here. The term has generally been used to refer to a complex system in which each of the subsystems is subordinated by an authority relation to the system it belongs to. More exactly, in a hierarchic formal organization each system consists of a "boss" and a set of subordinate subsystems. Each of the subsystems has a "boss" who is the immediate subordinate of the boss of the system. We shall want to consider systems in which the relations among subsystems are more complex than in the formal organizational hierarchy just described. We shall want to include systems in which there is no relation of subordination among subsystems. (In fact even in human organizations the formal hierarchy exists only on paper; the real flesh-and-blood organization has many interpart relations other than the lines of formal authority.) For lack of a better term I shall use "hierarchy" in the broader sense introduced in the previous paragraphs to refer to all complex systems analyzable into successive sets of subsystems and speak of "formal hierarchy" when I want to refer to the more specialized concept.3

3. 数学术语“分区”不适用于我在这里所说的层次结构；因为子系统集和每个子系统中的连续子集定义了分区，与子集之间的关系系统无关。我所说的“层次结构”是指分区及其各部分之间的关​​系。

3. The mathematical term "partitioning" will not do for what I call here a hierarchy; for the set of subsystems and the successive subsets in each of these define the partitioning, independent of any systems of relations among the subsets. By "hierarchy" I mean the partitioning in conjunction with the relations that hold among its parts.

社会系统

Social Systems

我已经举过社会科学中经常遇到的一种层级结构的例子——正式组织。商业公司、政府和大学都具有清晰可见的部分内部分结构。但正式组织并不是唯一的、甚至不是最常见的社会层级结构。几乎所有社会都有称为家庭的基本单位，这些单位可以分为村庄或部落，村庄或部落又可以分为更大的群体，等等。如果我们制作一张社会互动图表，标出谁与谁交谈，图表中密集互动的集群将确定一个相当明确的层级结构。该结构中的分组可以通过该社会计量矩阵中互动频率的某种度量来操作性地定义。

I have already given an example of one kind of hierarchy that is frequently encountered in the social sciences—a formal organization. Business firms, governments, and universities all have a clearly visible parts-within-parts structure. But formal organizations are not the only, or even the most common, kind of social hierarchy. Almost all societies have elementary units called families, which may be grouped into villages or tribes, and these into larger groupings, and so on. If we make a chart of social interactions, of who talks to whom, the clusters of dense interaction in the chart will identify a rather well-defined hierarchic structure. The groupings in this structure may be defined operationally by some measure of frequency of interaction in this sociometric matrix.

生物和物理系统

Biological and Physical Systems

生物系统的层级结构是众所周知的事实。以细胞为基本结构，我们发现细胞组成组织，组织组成器官，器官组成系统。细胞内有明确的子系统，例如细胞核、细胞膜、微粒体和线粒体。

The hierarchical structure of biological systems is a familiar fact. Taking the cell as the building block, we find cells organized into tissues, tissues into organs, organs into systems. Within the cell are well-defined subsystems—for example, nucleus, cell membrane, microsomes, and mitochondria.

许多物理系统的层次结构同样清晰。我已经提到了两个主要系列。在微观层面，我们有基本粒子、原子、分子和大分子。在宏观层面，我们有卫星系统、行星系统、星系。物质在整个空间中的分布非常不均匀。我们发现的最接近随机的分布，即气体，不是基本粒子的随机分布，而是复杂系统（即分子）的随机分布。

The hierarchic structure of many physical systems is equally clear-cut. I have already mentioned the two main series. At the microscopic level we have elementary particles, atoms, molecules, and macromolecules. At the macroscopic level we have satellite systems, planetary systems, galaxies. Matter is distributed throughout space in a strikingly nonuniform fashion. The most nearly random distributions we find, gases, are not random distributions of elementary particles but random distributions of complex systems, that is, molecules.

在我所定义的“层次结构”一词下，包含了相当多的结构类型。根据这个定义，钻石是层次结构的，因为它是碳原子的晶体结构，可以进一步分解为质子、中子和电子。然而，这是一个非常“扁平”的层次结构，其中属于晶体的一阶子系统的数量可以无限大。分子气体体积在同样的意义上是一个扁平的层次结构。在一般用法中，我们倾向于将“层次结构”一词保留给被划分为少量或中等数量子系统的系统，每个子系统都可以进一步细分。因此，我们 通常不会将钻石或气体视为或称为分层结构。类似地，线性聚合物只是由相同子部分（单体）组成的链，可能很长。在分子水平上，它是一个非常平坦的层次结构

A considerable range of structural types is subsumed under the term "hierarchy" as I have defined it. By this definition a diamond is hierarchic, for it is a crystal structure of carbon atoms that can be further decomposed into protons, neutrons, and electrons. However, it is a very "flat" hierarchy, in which the number of first-order subsystems belonging to the crystal can be indefinitely large. A volume of molecular gas is a flat hierarchy in the same sense. In ordinary usage we tend to reserve the word "hierarchy" for a system that is divided into a small or moderate number of subsystems, each of which may be further subdivided. Hence we do not ordinarily think of or refer to a diamond or a gas as a hierarchic structure. Similarly a linear polymer is simply a chain, which may be very long, of identical subparts, the monomers. At the molecular level it is a very flat hierarchy

在讨论正式组织时，直接向单个老板汇报的下属数量称为其控制范围。我将以类似的方式谈论系统的跨度，即系统划分成的子系统的数量。因此，如果等级制度在给定级别具有较宽的跨度，则该级别是平坦的。钻石在晶体级具有较宽的跨度，但在下一个级别即原子级则不宽。

In discussing formal organizations, the number of subordinates who report directly to a single boss is called his span of control. I shall speak analogously of the span of a system, by which I shall mean the number of subsystems into which it is partitioned. Thus a hierarchic system is flat at a given level if it has a wide span at that level. A diamond has a wide span at the crystal level but not at the next level down, the atomic level.

在以下章节的大部分理论构建中，我们将把注意力集中在中等跨度的层次结构上，但我将不时地评论这些理论在多大程度上可能适用于或不可能适用于非常扁平的层次结构。

In most of our theory construction in the following sections we shall focus our attention on hierarchies of moderate span, but from time to time I shall comment on the extent to which the theories might or might not be expected to apply to very flat hierarchies.

一方面，物理和生物等级与社会等级之间存在一个重要区别。大多数物理和生物等级都是用空间术语来描述的。我们检测细胞中的细胞器就像检测蛋糕中的葡萄干一样——它们是“明显”区分的子结构，在更大的结构中空间定位。另一方面，我们建议通过观察谁与谁互动而不是观察谁住在谁附近来识别社会等级。这两种观点可以通过用互动强度来定义等级来调和，但观察到在大多数生物和物理系统中，相对强烈的互动意味着相对的空间接近性。神经细胞和电话线的一个有趣特征是它们允许在很远的距离上进行非常特殊的强相互作用。如果互动是通过专门的通信和运输系统进行的，那么空间接近性对结构的决定性就会降低。

There is one important difference between the physical and biological hierarchies, on the one hand, and social hierarchies, on the other. Most physical and biological hierarchies are described in spatial terms. We detect the organelles in a cell in the way we detect the raisins in a cake— they are "visibly" differentiated substructures localized spatially in the larger structure. On the other hand, we propose to identify social hierarchies not by observing who lives close to whom but by observing who interacts with whom. These two points of view can be reconciled by defining hierarchy in terms of intensity of interaction, but observing that in most biological and physical systems relatively intense interaction implies relative spatial propinquity. One of the interesting characteristics of nerve cells and telephone wires is that they permit very specific strong interactions at great distances. To the extent that interactions are channeled through specialized communications and transportation systems, spatial propinquity becomes less determinative of structure.

符号系统

Symbolic Systems

到目前为止，我所举的例子都忽略了一类非常重要的系统：人类符号生产系统。一本书就是一个层次结构，我就是这么用这个词的。它通常分为章节，章节分为节，节分为段落，段落分为句子，句子分为小节和短语， 把从句和短语分解成单词。我们可以把单词作为基本单位，也可以像语言学家经常做的那样，进一步细分成更小的单位。如果这本书是叙事性的，那么它可能会分成“情节”而不是章节，但还是会有分节。

One very important class of systems has been omitted from my examples thus far: systems of human symbolic production. A book is a hierarchy in the sense in which I am using that term. It is generally divided into chapters, the chapters into sections, the sections into paragraphs, the paragraphs into sentences, the sentences into clauses and phrases, the clauses and phrases into words. We may take the words as our elementary units, or further subdivide them, as the linguist often does, into smaller units. If the book is narrative in character, it may divide into "episodes" instead of sections, but divisions there will be.

音乐的层次结构以乐章、部分、主题、乐句等单位为基础，这是众所周知的。绘画艺术作品的层次结构更难描述，但我以后会谈到这一点。

The hierarchic structure of music, based on such units as movements, parts, themes, phrases, is well known. The hierarchic structure of products of the pictorial arts is more difficult to characterize, but I shall have something to say about it later.

复杂系统的演化

The Evolution of Complex Systems

让我用一个寓言来引出进化论的话题。从前有两个钟表匠，一个叫霍拉，一个叫坦普斯，他们制作的钟表非常精致。他们两人都备受推崇，作坊里的电话响个不停——不断有新顾客打来电话。然而，霍拉生意兴隆，而坦普斯却越来越穷，最后失去了店铺。原因是什么呢？

Let me introduce the topic of evolution with a parable. There once were two watchmakers, named Hora and Tempus, who manufactured very fine watches. Both of them were highly regarded, and the phones in their workshops rang frequently—new customers were constantly calling them. However, Hora prospered, while Tempus became poorer and poorer and finally lost his shop. What was the reason?

这些人制造的手表每只都由大约 1,000 个零件组成。Tempus 的手表结构非常独特，如果他将一块组装好的手表放下（比如说接电话），手表就会立即散架，必须重新组装。顾客越喜欢他的手表，他们给他打电话的次数就越多，他就越难找到足够的时间来完成一只手表。

The watches the men made consisted of about 1,000 parts each. Tempus had so constructed his that if he had one partly assembled and had to put it down—to answer the phone, say—it immediately fell to pieces and had to be reassembled from the elements. The better the customers liked his watches, the more they phoned him and the more difficult it became for him to find enough uninterrupted time to finish a watch.

霍拉制造的手表并不比坦普斯的手表复杂。但他设计这些手表是为了能够组装大约十个零件的组件。十个这样的组件又可以组装成一个更大的组件；而十个后者组件组成的系统则构成了整块手表。因此，当霍拉不得不放下一块部分组装好的手表去接电话时，他只损失了一小部分工作，而且他组装手表所花的工时只是坦普斯所花工时的一小部分。

The watches that Hora made were no less complex than those of Tempus. But he had designed them so that he could put together subassemblies of about ten elements each. Ten of these subassemblies, again, could be put together into a larger subassembly; and a system of ten of the latter subassemblies constituted the whole watch. Hence, when Hora had to put down a partly assembled watch to answer the phone, he lost only a small part of his work, and he assembled his watches in only a fraction of the man-hours it took Tempus.

对坦帕斯和霍拉任务的相对难度进行定量分析相当容易：假设在将零件添加到未完成的组件中时发生中断的概率为p。那么坦帕斯能够不间断地完成他已经开始的手表的概率是 (1 - p) 1000 — 除非p非常小，否则这是一个非常小的数字 为 0.001 或更少。每次中断平均花费组装1/p个零件（中断前预期组装数量）的时间。另一方面，Hora 必须完成 111 个子组件，每个组件 10 个零件。他在完成其中任何一个时不会被打断的概率是 (1 - p)1°，每次中断仅花费组装五个零件所需的时间。4

It is rather easy to make a quantitative analysis of the relative difficulty of the tasks of Tempus and Hora: suppose the probability that an interruption will occur, while a part is being added to an incomplete assembly, is p. Then the probability that Tempus can complete a watch he has started without interruption is (1 — p)1000—a very small number unless p is 0.001 or less. Each interruption will cost on the average the time to assemble 1/p parts (the expected number assembled before interruption). On the other hand, Hora has to complete 111 subassemblies of ten parts each. The probability that he will not be interrupted while completing any one of these is (1 - p)1°, and each interruption will cost only about the time required to assemble five parts.4

现在，如果p约为 0.01（即有百分之一的概率，钟表匠在将任何一个零件添加到组件中时被打断），那么简单的计算就会表明，Tempus 组装一块手表的平均时间大约是 Hora 的四千倍。

Now if p is about 0.01—that is, there is one chance in a hundred that either watchmaker will be interrupted while adding any one part to an assembly—then a straightforward calculation shows that it will take Tempus on the average about four thousand times as long to assemble a watch as Hora.

我们得出的估计如下：

We arrive at the estimate as follows:

1. Hora 必须为每块手表制造 111 倍于 Tempus 的完整组件；但是

1. Hora must make 111 times as many complete assemblies per watch as Tempus; but

2. Tempus 每中断一次装配，平均损失的工作量是 Hora 的 20 倍（平均 100 个零件，而 Hora 为 5 个零件）；

2. Tempus will lose on the average 20 times as much work for each interrupted assembly as Hora (100 parts, on the average, as against 5); and

3. Tempus 每百万次尝试中只有 44 次能完成组装（0.991000 = 44 x 1Q- 6），而 Hora 十次尝试中只有九次能完成组装（0.9910 = 9 x 10-1）。因此，Tempus 每次完成组装的尝试次数与 Hora 相同，为 20,000 次。(9 X 10^1)/(44 X 10 6 ) = 2 X 10 4。将这三个比率相乘，我们得到

3. Tempus will complete an assembly only 44 times per million attempts (0.991000 = 44 x 1Q-6), while Hora will complete nine out of ten (0.9910 = 9 x 10-1). Hence Tempus will have to make 20,000 as many attempts per completed assembly as Hora. (9 X 10^1)/(44 X 10 6) = 2 X 104. Multiplying these three ratios, we get

4. 关于进化速度的推测最早是由 H. Jacobson 应用信息论来估计生物进化所需的时间时提出的。参见他的论文“信息、繁殖和生命起源”，载于《美国科学家》第 43 期（1955 年 1 月）：第 19-127 页。从热力学角度考虑，可以估计复杂系统分解成其元素时熵的增加量。（例如，参见 RB Setlow 和 EC Pollard 的《分子生物物理学》（Reading, Mass.: AddisonWesley, 1962），第 63-65 页，以及其中引用的参考文献。）但熵是概率的对数；因此，信息（熵的负数）可以解释为概率倒数的对数——可以说是“不可能性”。雅各布森模型的基本思想是，系统达到特定状态所需的预期时间与该状态的概率成反比 - 因此它会随着状态的信息量（负熵）呈指数增加。

4. The speculations on speed of evolution were first suggested by H. Jacobson's application of information theory to estimating the time required for biological evolution. See his paper "Information, Reproduction, and the Origin of Life," in American Scientist, 43(January 1955):! 19-127. From thermodynamic considerations it is possible to estimate the amount of increase in entropy that occurs when a complex system decomposes into its elements. (See for example, R. B. Setlow and E. C. Pollard, Molecular Biophysics (Reading, Mass.: AddisonWesley, 1962), pp. 63-65, and references cited there.) But entropy is the logarithm of a probability; hence information, the negative of entropy, can be interpreted as the logarithm of the reciprocal of the probability—the "improbability," so to speak. The essential idea in Jacobson's model is that the expected time required for the system to reach a particular state is inversely proportional to the probability of the state—hence it increases exponentially with the amount of information (negentropy) of the state.

按照这种论证思路，但没有引入层次和稳定子组件的概念，雅各布森估计进化所需的时间如此之大，以至于事件不太可能发生。我们的分析以同样的方式进行，但关注稳定的中间形式，得出的估计值要小得多。

Following this line of argument, but not introducing the notion of levels and stable subassemblies, Jacobson arrived at estimates of the time required for evolution so large as to make the event rather improbable. Our analysis, carried through in the same way, but with attention to the stable intermediate forms, produces very much smaller estimates.

生物进化

Biological Evolution

我们可以从生物进化的寓言中得到什么教训呢？让我们将部分完成的k 个基本部件的子组件解释为k 个部件在小体积中的共存——忽略它们的相对方向。该模型假设部件以恒定的速率进入体积，但除非组件达到稳定状态，否则在添加另一个部件之前，该部件会分散的概率为恒定的p。这些假设并不特别现实。它们无疑低估了随着组件尺寸的增加而实现组装的概率的降低。因此，这些假设低估了（可能低估了很大的因素）层次结构的相对优势。

What lessons can we draw from our parable for biological evolution? Let us interpret a partially completed subassembly of k elementary parts as the coexistence of k parts in a small volume—ignoring their relative orientations. The model assumes that parts are entering the volume at a constant rate but that there is a constant probability, p, that the part will be dispersed before another is added, unless the assembly reaches a stable state. These assumptions are not particularly realistic. They undoubtedly underestimate the decrease in probability of achieving the assembly with increase in the size of the assembly. Hence the assumptions understate— probably by a large factor—the relative advantage of a hierarchic structure.

因此，尽管我们不能认真对待数值估计，但生物进化的教训却非常明确和直接。从简单元素进化为复杂形式所需的时间主要取决于潜在中间稳定形式的数量和分布。特别是，如果存在一个潜在稳定“子组件”的层次结构，层次结构的每个级别的跨度s大致相同，那么可以预期子组件所需的时间在每个级别上都大致相同 - 即与 1/(1 - p}' 成比例。组装n 个元素的系统所需的时间将与 log s n 成比例，即与系统中的级别数成比例。有人会说 - 更具说明性而非字面意思 - 多细胞生物从单细胞生物进化所需的时间可能与单细胞生物从大分子进化所需的时间是同一个数量级。同样的论点可以应用于蛋白质从氨基酸进化、分子从原子进化、原子从基本粒子进化。

Although we cannot therefore take the numerical estimate seriously, the lesson for biological evolution is quite clear and direct. The time required for the evolution of a complex form from simple elements depends critically on the numbers and distribution of potential intermediate stable forms. In particular, if there exists a hierarchy of potential stable "subassemblies," with about the same span, s, at each level of the hierarchy, then the time required for a subassembly can be expected to be about the same at each level—that is, proportional to 1/(1 - p}'. The time required for the assembly of a system of n elements will be proportional to logs n, that is, to the number of levels in the system. One would say—with more illustrative than literal intent—that the time required for the evolution of multi-celled organisms from single-celled organisms might be of the same order of magnitude as the time required for the evolution of single-celled organisms from macromolecules. The same argument could be applied to the evolution of proteins from amino acids, of molecules from atoms, of atoms from elementary particles.

我确信，每一位生物学家、化学家和物理学家都会对这种过于简单的方案提出一大堆反对意见。在讨论我更了解的问题之前，我将先解决其中四个问题，其余问题留给专家们去解决。

A whole host of objections to this oversimplified scheme will occur, I am sure, to every working biologist, chemist, and physicist. Before turning to matters I know more about, I shall lay at rest four of these problems, leaving the remainder to the attention of the specialists.

首先，尽管钟表匠的寓言带有这种含义，但该理论并不假设目的论机制。复杂形式可以通过纯粹的随机过程从简单形式产生。（稍后我将提出另一个模型来清楚地说明这一点。）复杂形式一旦形成，其稳定性就会为该方案提供方向。但这只不过是适者生存，也就是稳定者生存。

First, in spite of the overtones of the watchmaker parable, the theory assumes no teleological mechanism. The complex forms can arise from the simple ones by purely random processes. (I shall propose another model in a moment that shows this clearly.) Direction is provided to the scheme by the stability of the complex forms, once these come into existence. But this is nothing more than survival of the fittest—that is, of the stable.

其次，并非所有大型系统都呈现出层次结构。例如，大多数聚合物（如尼龙）只是由大量相同成分（单体）组成的线性链。然而，就目前而言，我们可以简单地将这种结构视为跨度为 1 的层次结构——这是极限情况；因为任何长度的链都代表着相对平衡的状态/

Second, not all large systems appear hierarchical. For example, most polymers—such as nylon—are simply linear chains of large numbers of identical components, the monomers. However, for present purposes we can simply regard such a structure as a hierarchy with a span of one— the limiting case; for a chain of any length represents a state of relative equilibrium/

第三，进化过程并不违反热力学第二定律。从简单元素进化为复杂系统并不意味着整个系统的熵值变化。如果该过程吸收自由能，复杂系统的熵值将小于元素；如果它释放自由能，情况则相反。前一种情况适用于大多数生物系统，如果要不违反热力学第二定律，自由能的净流入必须来自太阳或其他来源。对于我们所描述的进化过程，中间状态的平衡只需要具有局部稳定性而不是全局稳定性，并且它们可能只在稳定状态下稳定——也就是说，只要有可以利用的外部自由能来源。6

Third, the evolutionary process does not violate the second law of thermodynamics. The evolution of complex systems from simple elements implies nothing, one way or the other, about the change in entropy of the entire system. If the process absorbs free energy, the complex system will have a smaller entropy than the elements; if it releases free energy, the opposite will be true. The former alternative is the one that holds for most biological systems, and the net inflow of free energy has to be supplied from the sun or some other source if the second law of thermodynamics is not to be violated. For the evolutionary process we are describing, the equilibria of the intermediate states need have only local and not global stability, and they may be stable only in the steady state—that is, as long as there is an external source of free energy that may be drawn upon.6

5. 有一套成熟的聚合物尺寸理论，基于随机组装模型。例如，参见 PJ Flory 的《聚合物化学原理》 （伊萨卡：康奈尔大学出版社，1953 年），第 8 章。由于聚合理论中的 t7// 子组装体是稳定的，因此分子生长的限制取决于杂质对端基的“毒化”或环的形成，而不是部分形成的链的破坏。

5. There is a well-developed theory of polymer size, based on models of random assembly. See, for example, P. J. Flory, Principles of Polymer Chemistry (Ithaca: Cornell University Press, 1953), chapter 8. Since t7//subassemblies in the polymerization theory are stable, limitation of molecular growth depends on "poisoning" of terminal groups by impurities or formation of cycles rather than upon disruption of partially formed chains.

6. 这一点以前曾多次被提及，但再怎么强调也不为过。有关进一步的讨论，请参阅 Setlow 和 Pollard 的《分子生物物理学》，第 49-64 页；E. Schrodinger 的《生命是什么？ 》（剑桥：剑桥大学出版社，1945 年）；以及 H. Linschitz 的《细菌细胞的信息内容》，收录于 H. Quastler 主编的《生物学中的信息理论》 （厄巴纳：伊利诺伊大学出版社，1953 年），第 251-262 页。

6. This point has been made many times before, but it cannot be emphasized too strongly. For further discussion, see Setlow and Pollard, Molecular Biophysics, pp. 49-64; E. Schrodinger, What Is Life? (Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 1945); and H. Linschitz, "The Information Content of a Bacterial Cell," in H. Quastler (ed.), Information Theory in Biology (Urbana: University of Illinois Press, 1953), pp. 251-262.

由于生物体不是能量封闭系统，因此无法从经典热力学考虑中推断出进化的方向，更不用说进化的速度了。所有估计都表明，单细胞生物体形成过程中涉及的熵量（以物理单位衡量）非常小——大约为 -10 11cal/度。7进化的“不可能性”与这种熵量无关，每个细菌细胞每一代都会产生这种熵量。从这个意义上说，信息量与进化速度无关，也可以从以下事实中看出，通过生殖过程“复制”一个细胞所需的信息量与通过进化产生第一个细胞所需的信息量完全相同。

Because organisms are not energetically closed systems, there is no way to deduce the direction, much less the rate, of evolution from classical thermodynamic considerations. All estimates indicate that the amount of entropy, measured in physical units, involved in the formation of a one-celled biological organism is trivially small—about -10 11cal/degree.7 The "improbability" of evolution has nothing to do with this quantity of entropy, which is produced by every bacterial cell every generation. The irrelevance of quantity of information, in this sense, to speed of evolution can also be seen from the fact that exactly as much information is required to "copy" a cell through the reproductive process as to produce the first cell through evolution.

稳定中间形式的存在对复杂形式的演变产生了强大的影响，这种影响可能类似于催化剂对开放系统中反应速率和反应产物稳态分布的巨大影响。8在这两种情况下，熵变都不能为我们提供系统行为的指导。

The fact of the existence of stable intermediate forms exercises a powerful effect on the evolution of complex forms that may be likened to the dramatic effect of catalysts upon reaction rates and steady-state distribution of reaction products in open systems.8 In neither case does the entropy change provide us with a guide to system behavior.

多细胞生物的进化

Evolution of Multi-Cellular Organisms

我们必须考虑对钟表匠隐喻的第四个反对意见。无论这个隐喻为原子和分子系统，甚至单细胞生物的进化提供了多么令人信服的模型，它似乎并不适合多细胞生物的历史。这个隐喻假设复杂系统是由一组简单系统的组合形成的，但这并不是多细胞生物进化的方式。尽管细菌实际上可能是由线粒体与其寄居的细胞合并而产生的，但多细胞生物是通过单个系统细胞的增殖和特化而进化的，而不是通过先前独立的子系统的合并而进化的。

We must consider a fourth objection to the watchmaker metaphor. However convincing a model the metaphor may provide for the evolution of atomic and molecular systems, and even uni-cellular organisms, it does not appear to fit the history of multi-cellular organisms. The metaphor assumes that complex systems are formed by combining sets of simpler systems, but this is not the way in which multi-cellular organisms have evolved. Although bacteria may, in fact, have been produced by a merging of mitochondria with the cells they inhabited, multi-cellular organisms have evolved through multiplication and specialization of the cells of a single system, rather than through the merging of previously independent subsystems.
